All of the remaining attributes, on the other hand, are proven to have a negative impact on the selection made above and among them F5, F10, F2, F3, and F7 are the most negative features.

narration: The prediction probabilities of labels C2 and C1 are 68.40% and 31.60%, respectively, therefore, the label assigned by the classifier, in this case, is C2. Per the feature attributions, F2 and F3 are the ones driving the decision away from the C2 label and in favour of the C1 label. Conversely, F8, F6, F4, F5, and F1 positively support the decision made by the classifier to label the case as C2. However, given that F3 and F2 are the only ones with a negative influence on the decision, it is surprising that the certainty associated with the C2 label is only 68.40% whereas that of C1 is 31.60%.

narration: The model identified that this test case's label is C1, with the likelihood of this being true being equal to 83.33%, but, there is a slim chance that it could be the other class, C2. This prediction decision is mainly influenced by the values of the features F7, F19, and F24. While the values of F7 and F19 motivate the prediction of C1, that of F24 shifts the decision towards C2. However, the joint impact of F7 and F19 outweighs the contribution of F24. Furthermore, the variables F1, F5, and F16 also positively support the model's output prediction here. F22, F13, and F26 have a similar direction of impact as F24. Unlike the features mentioned above, the features F11, F17, and F15 are shown to have very close to zero influence on the model's label decision.

narration: The model is not 100.0% confident that the label for the test case under consideration is C2, given that there is a 25.0% chance that the label could be C1. The above classification decision is mainly due to the attributions of the features F2, F12, F9, F3, and F11. While F9 and F11 have positive contributions to the prediction of C2, the values of F2, F12, F3, and F8 offer a very strong pull or shift towards predicting C1, explaining to some extent why there is a 25.0% chance that C1 is the correct label. Finally, those with limited influence on the prediction here include F7, F4, and F10, which all contribute negatively.

narration: The odds of C2 being the correct label for the given case is zero since the likelihood of C1 according to the model is 100.0%. The feature whose value influenced most the above classification is F4 while F1 is identified as the least. The attribution analysis further indicates that only F4 and F1  have positive contributions, increasing the prediction odds in favour of label C1. On the contrary, F6, F3, F5, and F2 have a negative impact insinuating that perhaps C2 could be the right label. Considering the fact that only a small number of the input features positively support the C1 prediction, it is surprising that the model is this confident about the verdict here.
